topic: How to design serverless handlers using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to design serverless handlers using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Designing Serverless Handlers Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to create serverless handlers using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+. It covers creating a FastAPI application, deploying it as a serverless function on AWS Lambda, and handling API requests.
key_points: Preparing the project for deployment on AWS Lambda
Setting up an AWS Lambda function with Python 3.12
Deploying the FastAPI application as a serverless function
Handling API requests in the serverless environment

code_examples.code:
pip install fastapi boto3 aws-lambda-inline-code zappa
zappa create --runtime python3.12 my_project

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this tutorial
Latest versions of Boto3 and AWS SDKs are preferred
caveats: Ensure your project's dependencies are compatible with the AWS Lambda layer you're using
AWS Lambda function memory and timeout settings may impact performance
Code size limitations apply to AWS Lambda, so be mindful of your imports and dependencies
